translated: The Mahayana Sutra called The Teaching of the Noble Vimalakirti

analyzed: buddhakṣetra pariśuddhi nidānam namaḥ sarva atīta pratyutpanna anāgatebhyaḥ buddha bodhi sattva ārya śrāvaka pratyekabuddhebhyaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Purification of the Buddha-field. Homage to all the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, Noble Disciples, and Pratyekabuddhas of the past, present, and future.

original: evaṃ mayā śrutam eakasmin samaye bhagavān vaiśālyāṃ viharati sma āmrapālīvane mahatā bhikṣusaṃghena sārdham aṣṭābhirbhikṣusahasraiḥ /
analyzed: evam mayā śrutam ā ekasmin samaye bhagavān vaiśālyām viharati smaḥ āmrapālī vane mahatā bhikṣu saṃghena sārdham aṣṭābhiḥ bhikṣu sahasraiḥ
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in Vaishali, in the grove of the caretaker of mango trees, together with a great assembly of eight thousand monks.

analyzed: sarvaiḥ arhadbhiḥ kṣīṇa āsravaiḥ niḥkleśaiḥ vaśībhūtaiḥ su vimukta cittaiḥ su vimukta prajñaiḥ ājāneyaiḥ mahā nāgaiḥ
translated: All of them were arhats, their defilements exhausted, their mental obstructions cleared away, their own welfare accomplished, their own goal achieved, their own burden laid down, their own affairs accomplished, their own fetters of existence severed, their own minds fully liberated, their own wisdom fully liberated, their own great elephants tamed,

analyzed: kṛtakṛtyaiḥ kṛta karaṇīyaiḥ apahṛta bhāraiḥ anuprāpta svaka arthaiḥ parikṣīṇa bhava saṃyojanaiḥ
translated: their own work done, their own goal accomplished, their own burden laid down, their own affairs accomplished, their own fetters of existence exhausted,

analyzed: sabhyak ājñā su vimukta cittaiḥ sarva cetaḥ vaśitā parama pāramitā prāptaiḥ
translated: their own minds fully liberated through right knowledge, having attained the utmost perfection of all mental powers.

original: dvātriṃśadā ca bodhisattvasahastraiḥ sārdham abhijñānābhijñātairbodhisattvairmahābhijñāparikarmaniryātairbuddhādhiṣṭhānādhiṣṭhitairdharmanagarapālaiḥ🔽saddharmaparigrāhakairmahāsiṃhanādibhirdaśadikṣu sugarjitanādairanadhyeṣitaṃ sarvasattvānām
analyzed: dvātriṃśadā ca bodhisattva sahastraiḥ sārdham abhijñāna abhijñātaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ mahā abhijñā parikarma niryātaiḥ buddha adhiṣṭhāna adhiṣṭhitaiḥ dharma nagara pālaiḥ  saddharma parigrāhakaiḥ mahā siṃhanādibhiḥ daśa dikṣu su garjita nādaiḥ anadhyeṣitam sarva sattvānām
translated: together with thirty-two thousand bodhisattvas, all of them well-known, bodhisattvas with higher knowledge, who had attained higher knowledge through thorough training, who were guardians of the city of the true Dharma,🔽who were upholders of the true Dharma, who roared the great lion's roar in the ten directions, who were unsolicited well-wishers to all beings,

analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra bhūtaiḥ tri ratna gotra an ācchedya kāribhiḥ nibṛta māra pratyarthikaiḥ sarva para pravādi anabhibhūtaiḥ
translated: who were spiritual friends, who ensured the continuity of the lineage of the Three Jewels, who had overcome the adversaries and Māra, who were not overwhelmed by any opposing doctrines,

analyzed: smṛti buddhi avabodha samādhi dhāraṇī pratibhāna sampannaiḥ sarva āvaraṇa paryutthāna vigataiḥ an āvaraṇa vimokṣa 🔽upasthitaiḥ an ācchedya pratibhānaiḥ dāna dama niyama saṃyama śīla kṣānti vīrya dhyāna prajñā upāya kauśalya praṇidhāna bala jñāna pāramitā niryātaiḥ anupalabdhi dharma kṣānti samanvāgataiḥ avaivartika dharma cakra pravartayadbhiḥ alakṣaṇa mudrā mudritaiḥ
translated: who were endowed with mindfulness, understanding, realization, concentration, retention, and eloquence, who were free from all obscurations and mental afflictions, who were established in the unobstructed liberation,🔽who had unobstructed eloquence, who had attained the perfections of generosity, discipline, restraint, self-control, morality, patience, diligence, concentration, wisdom, skillful means, aspiration, power, and knowledge, who were endowed with the acceptance of the non-apprehension of phenomena, who turned the irreversible wheel of the Dharma, who were sealed with the seal of the markless.

analyzed: sarva sattva indriya jñāna kuśalaiḥ sarva parṣad anabhibhūtasya baiśāradyena bikrāmibhiḥ mahā puṇya jñāna saṃbhāra saṃcitavadbhiḥ
translated: They were skilled in knowing the faculties of all beings, and they were fearless in not being overwhelmed by any assembly. They were victorious, having accumulated the great merit and wisdom collections.

analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa anuvyaṃjana alaṃkṛta kāyaiḥ variṣṭha rūpa dhāribhiḥ ca alaṃkāra apagataiḥ sumeru unnata śikhara
translated: Their bodies were adorned with all the major and minor marks, and they had the most excellent form. They were free from adornments, like Mount Sumeru's lofty peak.

analyzed: iva yaśaḥ kīrti abhyudgataiḥ vajra dṛḍha adhyāśayena buddha dharma saṃghe bhedya śraddhā pratilabdhaiḥ dharmaratna raśmyā amṛta vṛṣṭim
translated: Their fame and renown rose up, and their superior intention was as firm as a diamond. They had attained unshakable faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha. They rained down the nectar of the light rays of the precious Dharma

analyzed: su pravarṣayadbhiḥ sarva sattvānām śabda vāc aṃga svara śabda viśuddhi upeta svaraiḥ gambhīra dharma pratītyasamutpāde
translated: upon all beings. Their voices were pure, with the melodious sound of the Ganges. They practiced the profound Dharma of dependent origination.

analyzed: saṃdhi samanta chedaiḥ nirbhaya siṃha sadṛśaiḥ ghoṣa abhinirnādibhiḥ mahā dharma megha svara nādibhiḥ
translated: They had cut through the knots and all the views of the endless continuum. They were fearless like lions, and their voices resounded. They had the great Dharma cloud sound.

analyzed: sama visama dharma samatikrāntaiḥ dharma ratnasya prajñā puṇya saṃbhāra samudāgamasya mahā sārthavāhaiḥ
translated: They had transcended the Dharma of equality and inequality. They were great caravan leaders of the precious Dharma, who had fully accomplished the accumulation of wisdom and merit.

original: utthāpanasya ca śāntasūkṣmaślakṣṇasya ca durdṛśasya duravagāhyasya dharmasya naye vicakṣaṇaiḥ /
analyzed: utthāpanasya ca śānta sūkṣma ślakṣṇasya ca durdṛśasya duravagāhyasya dharmasya naye vicakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: They were skilled in the method of the Dharma, which is difficult to see and difficult to understand, of uplifting, pacifying, subtlety, and smoothness.

analyzed: sarva sattva āgama nirgama sattva āśaya gati anupraveśa jñāna viṣaya samarpitaiḥ
translated: They were dedicated to the sphere of knowledge that penetrates the thoughts, destinies, and conduct of all beings.

analyzed: asamasama buddha jñāne abhiṣekeṇa abhiṣiktaiḥ daśa bala vaiśāradye āveṇika buddha dharmeṣu
translated: They had been consecrated with the consecration of the wisdom of the unequaled, supreme Buddha, and had attained the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and the eighteen unique qualities of a Buddha.

analyzed: adhyāśayena pratipannaiḥ  sarva apāya bhairava durgati binipāta bhayasya parikhāyāḥ uttīrya
translated: They had set out with the highest motivation.🔽They had crossed over the moat of fear, the terrible lower realms and unfortunate destinies.

analyzed: saṃcintya sambhavasya gati utpatti deśikaiḥ mahā vaidya rājaiḥ
translated: They were great kings of physicians, teaching the path of birth and existence through intentional rebirth.

analyzed: sarva sattva vinayasya vidhi vidvadbhiḥ sarva sattvānām sarva kleśa roga avabodhaiḥ
translated: They were skilled in the methods of training all beings, and had realized the afflictions and illnesses of all beings.

analyzed: yathāyogam dharma bhaiṣajya yukti su prayuktavadbhiḥ guṇa anant ākara samarpitaiḥ ananta buddhakṣetrāṇi guṇa vyūhena su alaṃkṛtavadbhiḥ amogha darśana śravaṇaiḥ abandhya pāda utsargaiḥ
translated: They were skilled in applying the medicine of the Dharma according to what is appropriate, and were dedicated to the inexhaustible source of qualities. They had adorned infinite Buddha-fields with arrays of qualities, and their sight and hearing were never fruitless, nor was their setting foot in any place.

analyzed: koṭi nayuta śata sahasra aprameya kalpeṣu
translated: For many quintillions of immeasurable eons,

analyzed: ca anikṣiptadhureṇa ca pramatinā ca sundarajātena ca padmaśrīgarbheṇa padmavyūhena
translated: Anikṣiptadhurā, Pramati, Sundarajāta, Padmaśrīgarbha, Padmavyūha,

analyzed: ca avalokiteśvareṇa ca mahāsthāmaprāptena ca brahmamajālakena ca ratnaśvetāsanena ca

analyzed: mārajitā ca sama kṣetra alaṅkāreṇa ca maṇi ratna chatreṇa ca maṇicūḍena ca maitreyeṇa
translated: Mārajita, Samkṣetra, Alaṅkāra, Maṇiratnachattra, Maṇicūḍa, Maitreya,

original: ca mañjuśrīkumārabhūtena ca tairityādibhirdvātriṃśadā bodhisattvasahasraiḥ sārdham
analyzed: ca mañjuśrī kumāra bhūtena ca taiḥ ityādibhiḥ dvātriṃśadā bodhisattva sahasraiḥ sārdham
translated: Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, and with those thirty-two thousand bodhisattvas.
The four great elephants named Aśoka

original: nāmalokadhātorbrahmaśikhyādayo daśasahasram brahmaṇāṃ bhagavato darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya cāgatāḥ /
analyzed: nāma lokadhātoḥ brahmaśikhi ādayaḥ daśa sahasram brahmaṇām bhagavataḥ darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya ca āgatāḥ
translated: Ten thousand Brahmas, headed by Brahmaśikhin, from the pure world-realm, have come to see, venerate, attend upon, and listen to the Dharma of the Blessed One.

analyzed: te pi tasyām parṣadi eva saṃnipatitāḥ
translated: They too were assembled in that very assembly.
From the various four-continent great world systems,
twelve thousand Śakras had come.

analyzed: te pi tasyām parṣadi eva saṃnipatitāḥ
translated: They too were assembled in that very assembly.

original: evam anyacca maheśākhyamaheśākhyā brahmā kauśikaśca lokapāladevanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragarūḍakinnaramahoragā api tasyāṃ parṣadyeva saṃnipatitā
analyzed: evam anyat ca maheśākhya maheśākhyāḥ brahmā kauśikaḥ ca lokapāla deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garūḍa kinnara mahoragāḥ api tasyām parṣadi eva saṃnipatitā
translated: In the same way, other greatly powerful and greatly famous ones, Brahmā, Kauśika, the world guardians, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas were assembled in that very assembly.
They were present.

original: evameva catuṣpariṣad bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikā api tatra saṃnipatitā āsuḥ /
analyzed: evam eva catuṣpariṣad bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ api tatra saṃnipatitāḥ āsuḥ
translated: In the same way, the fourfold assembly of monks, nuns, male and female lay followers were also assembled there.

original: atha bhagavāṃśrīgarbhe siṃhāsane niṣaṇṇo 'nekaśatasahasraparṣadā parivṛtaḥ puraskṛto dharma deśayati sma /
analyzed: atha bhagavān śrīgarbhe siṃhāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ neka śata sahasra parṣadā parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ dharma deśayati sma
translated: Then the Blessed One, seated on the glorious womb lion throne, surrounded and revered by an assembly of many hundreds of thousands, was teaching the Dharma.

original: sumerūriva parvatarājaḥ samudrābhyudgataḥ sarvāḥ parṣado 'bhibhūya bhāsate tapati virocate sma śrīgarbhe sihāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: sumerūḥ iva parvata rājaḥ samudra abhyudgataḥ sarvāḥ parṣadaḥ bhibhūya bhāsate tapati virocate sma śrī garbhe sihāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Seated on the glorious womb lion throne, he shone, radiated, and glittered, surpassing all the assemblies, like Mount Meru, the king of mountains, rising above the ocean.

original: tato licchavikumāro ratnākaro bodhisatvo licchavikumārāṇām pañcaśatamātrañca saptaratnacchatraṃ samādāya /
analyzed: tatas licchavi kumāraḥ ratnākaraḥ bodhisatvaḥ licchavi kumārāṇām pañca śata mātram ca sapta ratna chatram samādāya
translated: Then the Licchavi youth Ratnākara, the Bodhisattva, together with five hundred Licchavi youths, took a seven-jeweled parasol,
and departed from the great city of Vaiśālī,

analyzed: yena āmrapālī vanam ca yena bhavavān tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: and went to the Ṛṣipatana Deer Park in the Ṛṣivadana Grove near Vārāṇasī.
Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One,

original: bhagavati saptakṛtvaḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya te ratnacchatraṃ yathā dhāriṇo bhagavantam abhitrāyante sma /
analyzed: bhagavati sapta kṛtvas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya te ratna chatram yathā dhāriṇaḥ bhagavantam abhitrāyante sma
translated: and circumambulated the Blessed One seven times to the right. Then, holding the jeweled parasol, they shaded the Blessed One.
Having shaded him, they stood to one side.

original: tāni niryātitāni ratnacchatrāṇi samanantaraṃ sadyo buddhānubhāvenaikībhūtvā /🔽tena ratnacchatreṇāyaṃ sarvatrisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātuaḥ saṃchāditaḥ pratibhāti sma /
analyzed: tāni niryātitāni ratna chatrāṇi samanantaram sadyas buddha anubhāvena ekībhūtvā  tena ratna chatreṇa ayam sarva tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātuḥ saṃchāditaḥ pratibhāti sma
translated: Immediately after those jeweled parasols were offered, by the Buddha's power they became one.🔽That jeweled parasol covered and illuminated this entire great trichiliocosm.🔽The extent of the great trichiliocosm was illuminated within that great jeweled parasol.

original: sa trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātupariṇāhaśva tasyaiva mahāratnacchatrasya madhye prabhāsito'bhūt ye🔽'smin trisāhasramahāsāhasralokadhātau kecanaparvatāḥ
analyzed: sa tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātu pariṇāhaḥ ca tasya eva mahā ratna chatrasya madhye prabhāsitaḥ bhūt ye 🔽smin tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātau kecana parvatāḥ
translated: Whatever mountains there are in this great trichiliocosm,

original: syuaḥ sumeruḥ parvatarājaśva himavantaparvataśca mucilindaparvataśva mahāmucilinda
analyzed: syuḥ sumeruḥ himavanta parvataḥ ca mucilinda parvata śva mahāmucilinda
translated: Sumeru, the king of mountains, and the Himalayas, and the Mucilinda mountain, and the Mahā-Mucilinda mountain,

original: parvataśca gandhamādanaśca ratnaparvatacca kālaparvataśca cakravāḍaśca mahācakravāḍaśca
analyzed: parvataḥ ca gandhamādanaḥ ca ratnaparvataḥ ca kālaparvataḥ ca cakravāḍaḥ ca mahācakravāḍaḥ ca
translated: and the Gandhamādana, and the Ratna mountain, and the Kāla mountain, and the Cakravāḍa, and the Mahā-Cakravāḍa,

original: sarve te 'pi tasyaiva mahāratnacchatrasya madhye prabhāsitāabhūvan /
analyzed: sarve te pi tasya eva mahā ratna chatrasya madhye prabhāsitāḥ abhūvan
translated: all of them were illuminated in the middle of that very great jewel parasol.

analyzed: yat asmin tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātau kiṃcid
translated: Whatever water there is in this great trichiliocosm,

original: syāt mahāsamudrasarastaḍāgapuṣkaraṇīnadīkunadīpalvalanimnaṃ sarvam tadapi tasyaiva mahāratnacchatrasya madhye prabhāsitam abhūt /
analyzed: syāt mahā samudra saraḥ taḍāga puṣkaraṇī nadī kunadī palvala nimnam sarvam tat api tasya eva mahā ratna chatrasya madhye prabhāsitam abhūt
translated: in the great ocean, in lakes, ponds, springs, rivers, streams, marshes, or low-lying areas, all of that was also illuminated in the middle of that very great jewel parasol.

analyzed: asmin tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra lokadhātau āditya candra vimāna aśva tārakā rūpāṇi deva bhavanāni
translated: In this great trichiliocosm, the palaces of the sun and moon, the forms of the stars, the heavenly abodes,

analyzed: ca nāga purāṇi ca catur mahārāja prāsādāśva
translated: the cities of the nāgas, the abodes of the yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, the palaces of the Four Great Kings,

analyzed: grāma nagara nigama rāṣṭra rājadhānyaḥ yāvatakāḥ syuḥ
translated: the villages, towns, markets, countries, and capitals, as many as there are,

original: sarvāstā api tasyaivaikākino mahāratnacchatrasyābhāsaṃ gacchanti sma /
analyzed: sarvāḥ tāḥ api tasya eva ekākinaḥ mahā ratna chatrasya ābhāsam gacchanti sma
translated: All of them were reflected in that single great jeweled parasol.

analyzed: daśa diś loke bhagavatām buddhānām yā dharma deśanā utpannā
translated: The Dharma teachings that arose from the Buddhas in the worlds of the ten directions

translated: We will protect those Dharma teachers within a distance of one league around them, so that no one who seeks to harm them, to overpower them, or to get the upper hand over them will be able to do so.
Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda, You should uphold this Dharma discourse, Ānanda.
Uphold it, and teach it extensively to others.
He said, When this Dharma discourse is upheld,
